sentences.sContent: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.sCn: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.sContent: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.sCn: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.sContent: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.sCn: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.sContent: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.sCn: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.sContent: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.sCn: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

sentences.sContent: ...and is spreading to rival firms too...

remMethod.val: 对手 (rival)隔河(river)相望， 分外眼红

trans.tranOther: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
